Smith Family Letters BCMS.0014Brooklyn CollectionBrooklyn Collection128 Pierrepont StBrooklyn, NY 11201bcref@bklynlibrary.orgThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2021-01-13T18:15:02engDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
Brooklyn Collection
Captain Freeman H. Smith Family Letters BCMS.0014
0.027 Cubic feet in 1 folder
1863-1865 Captain Freeman H. Smith was a whaler who died at sea in 1855. This collection consists of correspondence between his widow Agnes and son Arthur to Joseph Wickham Case, who administered his estate. 1
Arrangement note
The letters are arranged chronologically within the folder.
Immediate Source of Acquisition note
Purchased from Brian Merlis, March 1, 2013.
Scope and Content
Eleven letters from Agnes and Arthur Smith to Joseph Wickham Case, who administered the estate of Captain Freeman H. Smith, a whaler who died at sea in 1855. The letters date from 1863 to 1865 and are stored in one folder.
Preferred Citation
This collection should be cited as The Captain Freeman H. Smith Family Letters, Brooklyn Public Library â€“ Brooklyn Collection.
Smith, Captain Freeman H. Family
